entries.name: Talented Builder
entries: You have proficiency in one Tool of your choice. In addition, you learn new Tool proficiencies in half the normal amount of downtime weeks, rounded down. This reduction is applied last, after any reduction you may receive from your Intelligence modifier.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Elvish.

entries.name: Age
entries: A typical warforged is between two and thirty years old. The maximum warforged lifespan remains a mystery; so far, warforged have shown no signs of deterioration due to age. You are immune to magical aging effects.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most warforged take comfort in order and discipline, tending toward law and neutrality. But some have absorbed the morality, or lack thereof, of the beings with which they served.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Constructed Resilience
entries: You were created to have remarkable fortitude, represented by the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}, and you have resistance to poison damage.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.
You are immune to disease.
You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Sentry's Rest
entries: When you take a long rest, you must spend at least six hours in an inactive, motionless state, rather than sleeping. In this state, you appear inert, but it doesn't render you {@condition unconscious}, and you can see and hear as normal.

entries.name: Integrated Protection
entries: Your body has built-in defensive layers, which can be enhanced with armor:

items: You become proficient with light and medium armor.

You can don only armor with which you have proficiency. To don armor other than a shield, you must incorporate it into your body over the course of 1 hour, during which you remain in contact with the armor. To doff armor, you must spend 1 hour removing it. You can rest while donning or doffing armor in this way.
While you live, the armor incorporated into your body can't be removed against your will.

entries.name: Specialized Design
entries: You gain one skill proficiency and one tool proficiency of your choice.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: Revenant do not age. Given time, the necromantic energies that sustain you will heal most wounds you take at approximately the same rate as a mortal, and your hit die function as normal. A Revenant escapes the Rift due to one emotion they hold dear to their hearts. Emotions such as "Hope", "Anger", and "Desire" are common emotions among Revenants. Once the emotion that ties their existence dissipates (like the desire to see one's family, or the anger to see an enemy dead), the necromantic energies evaporate, and the Revenant dies.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Many Revenants cling to the alignment they held in their life, even if that life is but a distant memory in their minds. For others, the act of being swallowed by the Rift changes them drastically, and they adopt a new world view in light of what Shao has taught them.

entries.name: Past Life
entries: Choose another race besides this one; the race you select must be humanoid and lack the Living Construct trait (or similar). Even after being swallowed by the Rift, you maintain vague memories of this past life as this race. Your size, height, and movement speed are the same as this race. You do not retain special movement speeds from this race (such as flying, climbing, or swimming), and you do not carry over any racial features. If your past race had subraces, select one, but you do not carry over any racial features from that either.

entries.name: Living Dead
entries: You have been brought back from the Rift, but your form has changed drastically. You are immune to disease. You do not need to eat or breathe, but you can ingest food and drink if you wish. Additionally, you have two creature types: humanoid and undead. You can be affected by a spell or ability that works on either of your creature types.

entries.name: Onward to Salvation
entries: Escaping the Rift was no easy feat, and your new undead body assisted you in this endeavor. As an undead, you rarely tire. You treat exhaustion as if it was one level less. In addition, instead of sleeping, you enter an inactive state for 4 hours each day. You do not dream in this state; you are fully aware of your surroundings and notice approaching enemies and other events as normal.

entries.name: Unholy Gospel
entries: After breaking out of the Rift, you received a blessing known colloquially as a gospel. Unlike other undead, you can be restored through healing magic, but it has a significantly dampened effect on you. When you regain hit points from a source that specifies it does not function on undead, you instead receive half as many hit points as the source would provide, rounded down, instead of none.

entries.name: Eternal Vengeance
entries: The presence of those who defy the life cycle registers on the senses like a noxious odor. As an action, you can open your awareness to detect such creatures. Until the end of your next turn, you know the location of any undead creatures within 60 feet of you that are not behind total cover. You can use this feature a number of times equal to 1 + your Constitution modifier. When you finish a long rest, you regain all expended uses.

entries.name: Driven
entries: You have advantage on saving throws that would turn undead or would cause you to be {@condition Frightened}.

entries.name: Resurrection Beyond Death
entries: When you drop to 0 hit points, you can choose to stay conscious instead of falling unconscious. If you do, gain temporary hit points equal to your total character level + your Constitution modifier (minimum 1), which lasts for up to 1 minute.

In this state, you can take an action or a bonus action on your turn, but not both, and can move up to only half your movement speed. You remain in this state until you regain hit points, or until you no longer have temporary hit points. If you lose all temporary hit points in this state while you are at 0 hit points, you fall unconscious and begin making death saving throws as normal. Once you use this trait, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and two other languages of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: After receiving a Mark of Making, humans tend to manifest a lawful nature, even under less than ideal nuturing conditions.

entries.name: Artisan's Intuition
entries: When you make an {@skill Arcana} check or an ability check involving artisan's tools, you can roll a {@dice 1d4} and add the number rolled to the ability check.

entries.name: Forge's Gift
entries: You gain proficiency with one type of artisan's tools of your choice.

entries.name: Spellsmith
entries: You know the {@spell mending} cantrip. You can also cast the magic weapon spell with this trait. When you do so, the spell lasts for 1 hour and doesn't require concentration. Once you cast the spell with this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice. Humans typically learn the languages of other peoples they deal with, including obscure dialects. entries: After receiving a Mark of the Sentinel, humans tend to manifest a good nature, even under less than ideal nuturing conditions.

entries.name: Sentinel's Intuition

entries.name: Guardian's Shield
entries: You can cast the {@spell shield} spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to cast it after you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: Vigilant
entries: When a creature you can see within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can use your reaction to swap places with that creature, and you are hit by the attack instead. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Bound by the Duel

entries.name: The Bigger They Are
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can target a beast or monstrosity when you cast {@spell animal friendship} or {@spell speak with animals}, provided the creature's Intelligence score is 3 or lower.

entries: After receiving a Mark of Passage, humans tend towards a feeling of neutrality. They also tend to be more punctual and pertinent when receiving orders.

entries.name: Gait of Time
entries: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

entries.name: Intuitive Motion
entries: When you make an {@skill Acrobatics} check or any ability check to operate or maintain a land vehicle, you can roll a {@dice 1d4} and add the number rolled to the ability check.

entries.name: Magical Passage
entries: You can cast the {@spell misty step} spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest. Dexterity is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Humans tend toward no particular alignment. The best and the worst are found among them.

entries.name: Size
entries: Humans vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed Step
entries: In combat, you can use a bonus action to immediately gain the benefits of the Dash action. You can only use this trait once per long rest.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice. Humans typically learn the languages of other peoples they deal with, including obscure dialects. They are fond of sprinkling their speech with words borrowed from other tongues: Orc curses, Elvish musical expressions, Dwarvish military phrases, and so on.

entries.name: Age
entries: With the proper replacement parts and activities to occupy yourself, you can conceivably exist indefinitely. Nasods are known to degrade and lose their sanity, however, if they live too long without an explicit purpose. It is not known if this insanity visits all Nasods at old age, or just those whose resolve wavers.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Nasods possess mechanical minds, which find logic comforting. Generally, Nasods are lawful.

entries.name: Size
entries: As constructs modified by self-aware machines, Nasods could conceivably be perfectly uniform, like the Warforged that preceded them. However, the Foundries are either inherently flawed, or otherwise have a fondness for making diverse units, for each created Nasod is in some way unique. Nasod units stand between 5 and 7 feet tall and average about 150 to 300 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Created by Code
entries: Even though you were constructed, you are a living creature, represented by the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}, and you have resistance to poison damage.
You are immune to disease.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.

Instead of sleeping, you enter an inactive state for 4 hours each day. You do not dream in this state; you are fully aware of your surroundings and notice approaching enemies and other events as normal.
You can still be placed into a torpor by sleep-inducing magic.

entries.name: Thermal Vision
entries: Equipped with a heat-detecting thermal vision system beneath your eyelids, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades representative of thermal vision.

entries.name: Mind Over Matter
entries: Your mechanical mind is inherently logical, and is not easily swayed. You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}.

entries.name: Made to Assemble
entries: You gain two skill proficiencies of your choice and one {@book tool|phb|5|tools} proficiency of your choice.

entries.name: On the Line
entries: You know the {@spell mending} cantrip, and your casting time for this spell is an action. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it. You can cast {@spell mending} as an action a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier, and regain all expended uses on a short or long rest. While you have no remaining uses, the casting time of {@spell mending} becomes a minute.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Neural.

entries.name: It's Just Anti-Freeze
entries: You do not suffer any ill effects from extreme cold or heat.

entries.name: Autonomous Blaster Device
entries: You can cast the {@spell magic missile} spell with a 2nd-level spell slot once with this trait, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: Born in the Future
entries: You gain one exotic weapon proficiency or gain firearm proficiency.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Neural.

entries.name: Modern Magic
entries: You know the {@spell on/off} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell expeditious retreat} spell once per day. At 5th level, you can cast the {@spell levitate} spell once per day. Intelligence or Wisdom (your choice) is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Lightning Magnet
entries: As an action at the beginning of your turn, you can assume the form of lightning by breaking your physical form apart into all its components. Until the beginning of your next turn, you can take no actions, bonus actions, or reactions. In addition, you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, lightning, and thunder damage. You also ignore difficult terrain. After using this ability, you can use it again after you take a short or long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Neural.

entries.name: From the Oceans
entries: You gain a swimming speed of 30 feet, and gain one skill or weapon proficiency of your choice.

entries.name: Neural Synapses
entries: Using gestures and sounds, you can communicate simple ideas with Small or smaller beasts that have an inborn swimming speed.

entries.name: Rough Plating
entries: Your plating digs into the skin of those who attempt to grab you, forcing them to exchange the position of their hands constantly to avoid stabbing themselves. You have advantage on all checks to resist or escape a grapple.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Neural, and Aquan.

entries.name: Age
entries: Aftuan are theoretically immortal, but subsist off their legends in ancient folktales and stories. In order to continue their furrowed existence, they must continue to spread their creeping fear. A fear that can only be described as the fear of the unknown.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Aftuan are connected directly to Chaos, but this does not mean they're chaotic. Instead, their ability to view things from all aspects as Chaos guides them allows the Aftuan to take a uniquely true neutral approach to the world.

entries.name: Size
entries: Aftuan are between 5 feet to 8 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Your eyes give you superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, you only see in shades of blue.

entries.name: Alien Mind
entries: Unnatural. Unconventional. As an aftuan, your existence is beyond this world's boundaries. Your creature type is aberrant, rather than humanoid. In addition, you gain access to the following benefits as per your aberrant nature:

items: You have resistance to psychic damage.
You have advantage on saving throws against the {@condition frightened} and {@condition charmed} conditions.
You cannot suffer from the effects of madness.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.
You don't need to sleep and don't suffer the effects of {@condition exhaustion} due to lack of rest, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Whispers in the Beyond
entries: You learn the {@spell vicious mockery} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell dissonant whispers} spell once per day. At 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell crown of madness} spell once per day. Charisma is your spellcasting modifier for these spells.

entries.name: Limited Telepathy
entries: You can speak telepathically to other creatures within 60 feet. However, you can only speak Deep Speech this way, and creatures who don't speak Deep Speech can only make out distant, haunting whispers. The exception are creatures under the effects of Long-Term or Indefinite Madness, who can make out your words clearly, regardless of their known languages.

entries.name: Otherworldly Appendages
entries: Aftuan are birthed with four illithid tentactles that can manifest from any part of their body. Your additional appendages allow you to interact with an additional object or feature of the environment for free on your turn. You may not carry and use shields for defense with these additional appendages. Nor do they grant you additional attacks, or allow you to wield weapons with them for combat.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Deep Speech. In addition, you learn how to read Qualith.

entries.name: Age
entries: Ghosts do not age. Given time, the necromantic energies that sustain you will heal most wounds you take at approximately the same rate as a mortal, and your hit die function as normal.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Many Ghosts cling to the alignment they held in their life, even if that life is but a distant memory in their minds. For others, the act of being reborn as a ghastly entity on the mortal coil changes them significantly, and they adopt a new worldview in light of what their transformation has taught them.

entries.name: Past Life
entries: Choose another race besides this one; the race you select must be humanoid and lack the Living Construct trait (or similar). Even after being transformed in the Ethereal Plane, you maintain vague memories of this past life as this race. Your size, height, and movement speed are the same as this race. You do not retain special movement speeds from this race (such as flying, climbing, or swimming), and you do not carry over any racial features. If your past race had subraces, select one, but you do not carry over any racial features from that either.

entries.name: Undead
entries: You have been brought back to the mortal coil, but your form has changed drastically. You are immune to disease. You do not need to eat or breathe, but you can ingest food and drink if you wish. Your creature type is Undead.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and two other languages of your choice.

entries.name: Otherworldly Flight
entries: You gain a flying speed of 30 feet and can hover. To use this speed, you must attune to the Way of Worlds by act of sacrificing an attunement slot. Attuning to flight takes the same amount of time and follows the same restrictions as attuning to a magic item.
If you do not attune to the Way of Worlds, you can still fly using this feature. However, your maximum height is 5 feet. While flying this way, you can still hover.

entries.name: Deitic Force
entries: Your unarmed strikes can deal radiant or necrotic damage (your choice) instead of bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Incorporeal Stride
entries: You can move through other creatures and objects other than physical barriers (such as walls, floors, or ceilings) as if they were difficult terrain. On your turn, you can pass through up to 10 feet of physical barriers (treating them as difficult terrain) as a part of your movement. If you end your turn inside an object or barrier, you take {@dice 1d10}} force damage and are immediately ejected to the closest available space. You may use this ability an amount of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining any expended uses upon the completion of a short or long rest.

entries.name: Intangible
entries: You have advantage on all checks to resist or escape a grapple.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Spirit Binding
entries: As a Spirit, your ghastly form is not completely realized, and require an anchor to maintain your existence in the Material Plane. You must select an object or creature of your choice (it could be a heirloom, weapon, or ally) to bind to indefinitely.
• You must remain within 150 feet of your bound target at all times, and if the object leaves your 150 foot radius, you are dragged along with it.
• You are always aware of where your bound target is in relation to you.
• Should the object be destroyed or the creature slain, you immediately drop to 0 hit points.

• If you regain consciousness without a spirit bond, you must immediately select a new object or creature within 150 feet to bind to. If no items or creatures are present within 150 feet, you are paralyzed until one comes within 150 feet of you.

entries.name: Age
entries: Sacara mature at the same rate as humans and live for up to 200 years. Female Sacara shed their young tails at age 15 in order to grow into their adult tails, and all Sacara from 20 and onwards shed every 5 years, maintaining their ageless youth.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Sacara have a tendency to the neutral and evil spectrum of the alignment tree, as their society is largely built around the principle of individual strength, so concepts like good seminarianism are less prominent. Their scheming nature incline many Sacara toward a lawful alignment.

entries.name: Size
entries: Sacara maintain the same size and build as humans, although female Sacara manifest a serpentine body from the navel down. Their snake-like tails can extend anywhere from 5 to 9 feet long. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Viper's Resilience
entries: You have resistance to poison damage.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Due to your bestial nature, you have superior vision in dark and dim lit places. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in the darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in the darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Paralyzing Gaze
entries: Once you reach 5th level, you learn the spell {@spell hold person}. You can cast this spell once per long rest, as your paralyzing schlera are scratched and need time to regenerate. Intelligence is your spellcasting modifier for this spell.

entries.name: Serpent's Sting
entries: You gain the benefits of Serpent's Sting in one of three situations:
• At the start of your turn, if another creature is currently {@condition Grappled} by you.
• At the start of your turn, if another creature is currently grappling you.
• During your turn, when you successfully grapple another creature.

If you meet either of these conditions, you may use your serpentine hair to deliver a bite attack. This is a free action, and you may only target the creature you are grappling or being grappled by. You may only use Serpent's Sting once per turn, regardless of how many creatures you are grappling or are grappled by.

You are considered proficient in this bite attack, which deals piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength or Dexterity modifier. This damage increases to {@dice 2d6}} at 5th level. {@dice 3d6}} at 10th level, {@dice 4d6}} at 15th level, and {@dice 5d6}} at 20th level.

entries.name: Acidic Lungs
entries: You know the {@spell acid splash} cantrip. Your spellcasting modifier for this spell is Intelligence.

entries.name: Slithering Path
entries: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Abyssal, and Draconic.

entries.name: The Art of Intelligence
entries: Choose two tools from the following list: {@item Carpenter's tools|phb}, {@item Mason's tools|phb}, {@item Cobbler's tools|phb}, {@item Painter's tools|phb}, {@item Weaver's tools|phb}, {@item Glassblower's tools|phb}, or {@item Potter's tools|phb}. You gain proficiency in those tools, and you double your proficiency bonus for any ability checks you make with them.

entries.name: Serpent's Ward
entries: Once per long rest, one of your snakes can inject you or a creature within 5-feet of you with a special poison. Instead of harming the individual, this poison seeks to establish antibodies in the body of the individual to increase their resistances. When you use this feature, you choose one effect from the list of variations below:
{@bold Acid Ward}. The creature gains resistance to acid for one minute.
{@bold Poison Ward}. The creature gains resistance to poison for one minute.
{@bold Antivenom}. The creature is cured of the {@condition poisoned} condition and gains advantage on saving throws against the {@condition poisoned} condition for one minute.

entries.name: Master of High Places
entries: You gain a climb speed of 30 feet.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Abyssal, and Draconic.

entries.name: Age
entries: Fey mature at the same rate as humans, but are considered young until they reach the age of 100. On average, they live about 700 years. Archefaeries are unique in this regard—so long as their blessing is continually maintained by their guardian contractor, they live indefinitely. However, true immortality is rare, as extended time spent in human civilizations generally will erode an archfaerie's mind, disconnecting them from the wild and their guardian contractor forever. An archfaerie with a weak will needs to regularly return to the Feywild; otherwise, they generally survive for a maximum of 200 years in a human settlement.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Fey delight in living a life free of the mantle of law. They gravitate toward being good, but some have devious streaks and enjoy causing dismay.

entries.name: Size
entries: Fey range from just under 5 feet to about 6 feet in height, with generally slender builds. Your size is Medium, unless you are a Pixie. If you are a Pixie, your size is Tiny.

entries.name: The Great Summer Court
entries: Your creature type is fey, rather than humanoid.

entries.name: Attuned Flight
entries: You have a flying speed of 35 feet. To use this speed, you must attune to the Way of Worlds by act of sacrificing an attunement slot. Attuning to flight takes the same amount of time and follows the same restrictions as attuning to a magic item.

entries.name: Nimble Trickster
entries: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

entries.name: Tricker's Mirage
entries: One of the Summer Queen's many gifts was a blessing reminiscent of the playful pixies—a skill which allows you to immerse your body in the nature of world and become impossible to detect by mortal eyes. As an action, you become {@condition invisible} until the end of your next turn, or until you attack or cast a spell that targets another creature.
You can use this ability twice, and regain all expended uses on a short or long rest.

entries.name: Blessings of Autumn Wind
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against spells.

entries.name: Gift of the Summer Queen
entries: You learn the {@spell druidcraft} cantrip.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Heart Sight
entries: Your connection to the Feywild has allowed you to retrieve the hearts of mortals and distill their personalities onto a matrix, to which you can uncover their true sense of being. As a bonus action, you can target one creature within 60 feet of you. That creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw equal to your save DC (8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier).

On a failed save, you learn that creature's emotional state, and whether they are inflicted by any conditions or diseases. Celestials, fiends, and undead automatically fail the saving throw. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier, and regain all expended uses on a long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Elvish, and Sylvan.

entries.name: Attuned Flight
entries: You have a flying speed of 35ft. To use this speed, you must attune to the Way of Worlds by act of sacrificing an attunement slot. Attuning to flight takes the same amount of time and follows the same restrictions as attuning to a magic item. This flight is not affected by Antimagic fields.

entries.name: Amongst Giants
entries: Tiny creatures have advantage on Dexterity saving throws, but disadvantage on Strength saving throws. In addition, tiny creatures can move into the spaces of creatures that are small or larger, provoking opportunity attacks as normal. They have a reach of 0 feet, meaning they must be in the same space as a creature to use a weapon or touch spell. This feature does not take effect if you are not currently considered Tiny.

entries.name: Pixie Magic
entries: You know the {@spell Druidcraft}, {@spell Mending}, and {@spell Faerie Fire} spells. You can cast {@spell Faerie Fire} without expending a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it this way again. You can also cast this spell using any spell slots you have. Your spellcasting ability for these spells is your choice of Intelligence, or Charisma.

entries.name: Wrath of the Wee fey
entries: Your Pixie upbringing makes you more martial than most and as such you have some training with weapons. You have proficiency with Shortbows, Shortswords, Hand Crossbows, Sickle, Slings, Pikes, and Shields. These weapons are specially made and must be properly sized for you due to your size.

entries.name: Pixie Dust
entries: If you are standing in an allied creatures space, you can use a bonus action to give them temporary flight. This flight lasts two rounds and grants a flying speed equal to the creatures walking speed. This ability can only be used up to your Constitution Modifier. This Ability recharges on a long rest.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition charmed} condition on yourself and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Fey Passage
entries: You can squeeze through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide.

entries.name: Languages
entries: Common, Sylvan, and one other of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: A Mousefolk reaches adulthood at the age of 5 and lives to be about 60 years old.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most Mousefolk are neutral, and tend towards good. They try to keep the conflicts of the other races at arm's length, but display remarkable ferocity when their friends, families, or communities are threatened. A reverence for nature and life is close to the heart of Mousefolk, and they are loath to take a life if it can be avoided. They prefer to live quiet and unassuming lives, giving honest work for honest pay.

entries.name: Size
entries: Mousefolk grow between 2 and 2 1/2 feet tall and weigh about 25 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Keen Eye
entries: You have proficiency in the Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) skill.

entries.name: Fleet of Foot
entries: You have proficiency with the rapier, shortsword, shortbow, and handaxe.

entries.name: Artistry
entries: You gain proficiency with one type of artisan's tools or one musical instrument.

entries.name: Squirm
entries: You can move through tiny-sized spaces as if you were tiny.

entries.name: Nimble Sense
entries: When targeted with an attack of opportunity, you may use your reaction to impose disadvantage on that attack.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Squeak Speak, and Halfling.

entries.name: Brave Heart
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

entries.name: Grace of the Small
entries: Through sounds and gestures, you can communicate simple ideas with Small or smaller beasts.

entries.name: Invoke Gift
entries: You can instill power into the weapon of a nearby creature to enhance their blow with divine energy. As an action, a creature within 30 feet of you.

Until the end of your next turn, the next time that creature succeeds on a melee weapon attack, that creature heals for {@dice 1d10} hit points (if you are good or neutral) or gains {@dice 1d8} temporary hit points (if you are evil). Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Squeak Speak, and Halfling.
